Body: Possible Duplicate:  Knowing which applications to stop  I just got a used Nexus One and I see a lot of running services and applications.  I'm wondering what negative impact there would be if I just started switching them off?  For example, obviously, I don't want to mess with "Calendar," but what about "Calendar Storage?" If I install Handcent SMS, do I still need the Messaging-related services/applications?  Same for Media: if I install Winamp, do I still need those?
Title: What running applications and services are safe to turn off?

history.Text: I just got a used Nexus One and I see a lot of running services and applications.  I'm wondering what negative impact there would be if I just started switching them off?  For example, obviously, I don't want to mess with "Calendar," but what about "Calendar Storage?" If I install Handcent SMS, do I still need the Messaging-related services/applications?  Same for Media: if I install Winamp, do I still need those?
What running applications and services are safe to turn off?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Knowing which applications to stop](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/2906/knowing-which-applications-to-stop)  I just got a used Nexus One and I see a lot of running services and applications.  I'm wondering what negative impact there would be if I just started switching them off?  For example, obviously, I don't want to mess with "Calendar," but what about "Calendar Storage?" If I install Handcent SMS, do I still need the Messaging-related services/applications?  Same for Media: if I install Winamp, do I still need those?
